text: In the crockpot, combine {{butter}}, {{chicken}}, {{onion}}, {{shallot}}, {{garlic}}, {{celery}}, and {{carrot}}. Pour in {{chicken_broth}}. Stir in {{thyme}}, {{sage}}, {{rosemary}}, and {{bay_leaf}}; season with {{salt}} and {{black_pepper}}. Add {{parmesan_rind}} if using.
Cover and cook on low for 4–6 hours or on high for 2–4 hours. Shred the {{chicken}}.
About 20 minutes before serving, stir in {{rice}}, {{spinach}}, {{parsley}}, and {{lemon_juice}}. Cook for 15–20 minutes, until the rice is tender.
Ladle into bowls and top with extra {{parsley}} if desired.

In a Dutch oven, combine {{butter}}, {{chicken}}, {{onion}}, {{shallot}}, {{garlic}}, {{celery}}, and {{carrot}}. Pour in {{chicken_broth}}. Stir in {{thyme}}, {{sage}}, {{rosemary}}, and {{bay_leaf}}; season with {{salt}} and {{black_pepper}}. Add {{parmesan_rind}} if using.
Bring to a boil over high heat. Cook for 5 minutes, then reduce to low, cover, and simmer for 30 minutes or longer. Shred the {{chicken}}.
About 20 minutes before serving, stir in {{rice}}, {{spinach}}, {{parsley}}, and {{lemon_juice}}. Cook for 15–20 minutes, until the rice is tender.
Ladle into bowls and top with extra {{parsley}} if desired.
